    • Method Detail

      • login

        public static OndusService login(java.lang.String refreshToken)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
        Main entry point for the OndusService to obtain an initialized instance of it. When calling this method, the provided refreshAuthorization token will be used to obtain a fresh access token from the GROHE Api, which will be saved in this OndusService instance.

        The access token currently is valid for one hour, however it will not be refreshed automatically. If it expires, you need to create a new instance of OndusService.

        Parameters:
        refreshToken - The refreshTokenResponse of the GROHE account
        Returns:
        An initialized instance of OndusService with the username or password
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a communication error occurs
        javax.security.auth.login.LoginException - If the login credentials are rejected by the API

      • loginWebform

        public static OndusService loginWebform(java.lang.String username,
                                        java.lang.String password)
                                 throws java.io.IOException,
                                        javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
        Main entry point for the OndusService to obtain an initialized instance of it. When calling this method, the provided credentials will be checked against the GROHE Api and an access token will be saved in this OndusService instance.

        The access token currently is valid for 6 months, however it will not be refreshed automatically. If it expires, you need to create a new instance of OndusService.

        This login method is using the GROHE web form to obtain a token / refresh token. This can be used for accounts that don't work with the legacy login method.

        Parameters:
        username - The username of the GROHE account
        password - The password of the GROHE account
        Returns:
        An initialized instance of OndusService
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a communication error occurs
        javax.security.auth.login.LoginException - If the login credentials are rejected by the API

      • authorizationExpiresAt

        public java.time.Instant authorizationExpiresAt()
        Returns the time at which the internally saved authorization will expire. It is advised that users of this class use this value after logging in to ensure that the authorization is refreshed before it actually expires. Actually refreshing the authorization is done by refreshAuthorization().
        Returns:
        The point in time when the authorization is expired

      • refreshAuthorization

        public java.lang.String refreshAuthorization()
                                      throws java.io.IOException,
                                             javax.security.auth.login.LoginException
        Refreshed the internally saved authorization information (if necessary) and uses the refreshed authorization for upcoming requests to the GROHE Api.
        Returns:
        Returns the new refreshToken, which is also now saved internally in the service
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        javax.security.auth.login.LoginException

      • appliances

        public java.util.List<BaseAppliance> appliances()
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieve a list of appliances saved in the GROHE account used when logging in. This method returns a list of devices out of all rooms and locations. You can filter later on by inspecting the room and the associated location of a room, if you've the need to filter.
        Returns:
        A list of appliances of the GROHE account
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a communication error with the GROHE API occurs

      • getAppliance

        public java.util.Optional<BaseAppliance> getAppliance(Room inRoom,
                                                      java.lang.String applianceId)
                                               throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieves a single BaseAppliance object from the Api without querying for all appliances inside the GROHE account.
        Parameters:
        inRoom - The Room to look for the appliance in
        applianceId - The room ID as retrieved by the GROHE Api
        Returns:
        One specific Appliance
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a communication error occurs

      • applianceData

        public java.util.Optional<BaseApplianceData> applianceData(BaseAppliance appliance)
                                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieves the BaseApplianceData saved for the appliance in the GROHE account. This method will query for the whole set of data saved for the appliance up to the (yet unknown) limit of the GROHE api. Consider using applianceData(BaseAppliance, Instant, Instant) to minimize the length of the result and the payload exchanged with the GROHE Api.
        Parameters:
        appliance - The Appliance to retrieve data from
        Returns:
        The ApplianceData of the appliance
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a communication error occurs

      • applianceData

        public java.util.Optional<BaseApplianceData> applianceData(BaseAppliance appliance,
                                                           java.time.Instant from,
                                                           java.time.Instant to)
                                                    throws java.io.IOException
        The same as applianceData(BaseAppliance), however, limits the requested data to a specific time range instead of requesting all data from all time.
        Parameters:
        appliance - The BaseAppliance to retrieve data from
        from - Needs to be an instance of Instant which is at least one day before to
        to - Needs to be an instance of Instant which is at least one day after from
        Returns:
        The ApplianceData of the appliance in the given time range
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a communication error occurs

      • applianceCommand

        public java.util.Optional<BaseApplianceCommand> applianceCommand(BaseAppliance appliance)
                                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieves the current state of the appliances ApplianceCommand saved for the appliance in the GROHE account. This can be used to inspect the current state of the appliance and activated/queued commands.
        Parameters:
        appliance - The Appliance to retrieve command information from
        Returns:
        The ApplianceCommand of the appliance
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a communication error occurs

      • applianceStatus

        public java.util.Optional<ApplianceStatus> applianceStatus(BaseAppliance appliance)
                                                    throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieves the current status of the appliance. Note that the available properties of the returned ApplianceStatus object may differ from appliance type to appliance type.
        Parameters:
        appliance - The BaseAppliance to retrieve command information from
        Returns:
        The ApplianceStatus of the appliance
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a communication error occurs

      • setValveOpen

        public void setValveOpen(Appliance appliance,
                         boolean open)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Changes the valve state of the appliance. The call to this function is blocking until the API acknowledges the execution or failure of the command.
        Parameters:
        appliance - The appliance to change the valve state of
        open - The requested valve state
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When a communication error occurs
